This looks reasonable, given how it is used.

Please update the godoc to indicate the change in logic, and add unit tests to cover the following cases:
* `""`
* `"-"`
* `"-foo"`
* `"-foo-"`

Hey @liggitt, I just had a quick question: to mask the trailing dash, wouldn't `name[:len(name)-1]` suffice instead of the `-2`?

https://play.golang.org/p/yxWAJQgeAa9

We don't want to mask the `-` if it is also the leading character

The point of masking the suffix is that for generated names, a random alpha-numeric is appended, which would make `foo-` a valid dns name. We don't want to replace `-` with `a` if it is also the prefix, since `-`+suffix would not be a valid dns name.
